```{r}
#| label: dados
#| echo: false

library(pacman)

p_load(
    exams,
    readxl,
    writexl,
    tidyverse
)

options(scipen = 999) #prevent scientific notation

# parâmetros
a <- rexp(1, 0.75)
b <- rexp(1, 0.75)

# letra a)
sequencia <- seq(from = floor(qbeta(0.01, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)), to = ceiling(qbeta(0.99, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)), by = 1)
n_conj <- min(sample.int(length(sequencia), 1), 10)
conj <- sample(sequencia, n_conj) |> sort()

# letra b)
x_b <- runif(1,
    qbeta(0.5, shape1 = a, shape2 = b),
    qbeta(0.75, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)
) |> round(2)

# letra c)
x_c <- runif(1,
    qbeta(0.25, shape1 = a, shape2 = b),
    qbeta(0.5, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)
) |> round(2)

# letra d)
x_d1 <- runif(1,
    qbeta(0.1, shape1 = a, shape2 = b), qbeta(0.25, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)) |>
    round(2)
x_d2 <- runif(1,
    qbeta(0.75, shape1 = a, shape2 = b), qbeta(0.9, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)) |>
    round(2)

# Solução
sol <- c(
    "a" = 0,
    "b" = 1 - pbeta(x_b, shape1 = a, shape2 = b),
    "c" = pbeta(x_c, shape1 = a, shape2 = b),
    "d" = pbeta(x_d2, shape1 = a, shape2 = b) - pbeta(x_d1, shape1 = a, shape2 = b)
) |> round(4)

f <- \(x) format(
    round(x, 2),
    big.mark = ".",
    decimal.mark = ","
)
```

Question
========

Seja X uma variável aleatória contínua onde X &sim; &Beta;(`r f(a)`; `r f(b)`). 

Calcule as seguintes probabilidades.

Questionlist
------------

* P(X &isin; {`r paste0(conj, collapse=", ")`}): 
* P(X &ge; `r f(x_b)`): 
* P(X &le; `r f(x_c)`)
* P(`r f(x_d1)` < X < `r f(x_d2)`):

Solution
========

Solutionlist
-------------

* P(X &isin; {`r paste0(conj, collapse=", ")`}): 0.
* P(X &ge; `r f(x_b)`): `r f(sol[2])`.
* P(X &le; `r f(x_c)`): `r f(sol[3])`.
* P(`r f(x_d1)` < X < `r f(x_d2)`): `r f(sol[4])`.
